byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY, JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Democratic leaders are becoming more concerned over Hillary Rodham Clinton's inability to put questions about her State Department email practices behind her; they fret over her apparent lack of seriousness about issue and rising doubts among voters about her trustworthiness and honesty; supporters fear controversy could create opening for Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr to enter presidential race and open Clinton to further Republican attacks if she is nominated.
lead_paragraph: Concerns are growing that Hillary Rodham Clinton is not treating the matter seriously, or doing enough to put it to rest before it harms her 2016 run and other Democrats’ campaigns.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton’s Handling of Email Issue Frustrates Democratic Leaders
headline.print_headline: Democrats See an Email Issue That Won’t Die

snippet: Concerns are growing that Hillary Rodham Clinton is not treating the matter seriously, or doing enough to put it to rest before it harms her 2016 run and other Democrats’ campaigns.
